alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 3:49PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Colorado, including the following county, Grand and eastern portions of the East Troublesome burn area. * WHEN...Until 515 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 349 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Up to 0.3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Trail Creek, Colorado River, Willow Creek, Gold Run and Soda Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of East Central Grand County - This includes the following additional locations... Columbine Lake, rising water in the Colorado River along River Rd and Lower Stillwater Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Heavy Rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the East Troublesome burn area. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows.
